introduction:
• Linear Algebra is a foundational discipline in Science and Engineering, with applications in various fields such as Computer Graphics, Data Science, Physics, Machine Learning and many other technological and scientific domains.
  • This lab is designed to make abstract concepts of Linear Algebra easier to understand and hence enable user to apply these wherever needed.
  • The theory section is supplemented with schematic representations to facilitate understanding and a deeper appreciation of the intrinsic concepts. Illustrative examples of various types are also provided.
  • Simulation is supported by dynamic interface for hands on practice. Dynamic outcomes are linked on multiple pages as and when required.
  • Interactive exercises are provided in simulation, making it knowledgeable and interesting.
  • Graphical representations are provided in simulation for geometrical visualization.
  • Self-assessments in simulation are well aligned with the experiments.
  • Pre-tests are structured to enable learners to assess their pre-requisite knowledge from prior experiments or foundational concepts. Post-tests are administered after the experiment and are designed to enable users to evaluate their understanding of the experiment.
  • Procedure for simulation has been given separately, while the interface is also user-friendly.

experiments.name: Euclidean Space as a Vector Space
Linear Independence, Basis, Dimension and Coordinates
Linear Transformations and Their Connection with Matrices
Rank and Nullity of Linear Transformations and Matrices
Linear Map Equation and Its Solution
Solution of System of Linear Equations using Linear Map Equation
Eigen Values, Eigen Vectors and Diagonalization
Application to Ordinary Linear Differential Equations and Engineering Problems

UG: The Linear Algebra Virtual Lab is intended for undergraduate (UG) students in science and engineering, as well as faculty members and research scholars.
PG: The Linear Algebra Virtual Lab is intended for Postgraduate (PG) students in science and engineering, as well as faculty members and research scholars.

objective: The Linear Algebra Virtual Lab aims to provide a comprehensive understanding and visualization of the fundamental concepts of Linear Algebra with special focus on Systems of Linear Equations with application to Ordinary Linear Differential Equations, in a user-friendly manner. It also aims to encourage learning beyond traditional methods by promoting intuitive and hands-on engagement through examples, schematics and interactive and dynamic interface.
